column5: Hey gang  Going through my grandpas old tackle box I found around 20 of these bullet weights  Looks like a way more cost effective version of the screw in weights  Anyone ever use these  Can you still get em?
we use to put spinnerbait skirts on them to make a more versatile Texas rig bait sinker
Looking at the pic, it looks like a stone material, or is it lead ? Looks like something that could make a come back.  Cool pass down.
Almost looks like a collared bullet head jig, that some one forgot to put the hook in the mold on.
That's what I thought  Instead of a hook just a shaft straight through to make a hole for the line  I was surprised how well it pops in the plastic
no it was meant for a skirt, thats how they were sold
Yup  Looks like a nicer version of grandpa's

yeah i had the exact same ones as you grandfather in 5 different sizes you would change the skirt to match the worm you were using they did work but you had to peg them with a toothpick or they would slide up the line and the fish would bite them rather then the hook
Its called a slip jig,do-it still makes a mold for it model # slip-6-a has 6 cavity's 1/8-3/16-1/4-3/8-1/2-9/16 sells for $51.95 depending on where you get it.
Punch Skirt used a lot in Florida.  Tooth picks are old school, most use bobber stops now.
